intro: Dendromyza acutata, commonly known as the sharpleaf dendromyza, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes plants such as hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
